title: ਵਿਆਹ ਦੇ ਪਹਿਲੇ ਹੀ ਦਿਨ ਨਪੁੰਸਕ ਕਹਿ ਕੇ ਛੱਡ ਗਈ ਪਤਨੀ, ਪਤੀ ਨੇ ਚੁੱਕਿਆ ਖੌਫਨਾਕ ਕਦਮ...
content: ਹਰਿਆਣਾ ਦੇ ਸੋਨੀਪਤ ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹੇ ਦੇ ਗੋਹਾਨਾ ਵਿਚ ਇਕ ਨੌਜਵਾਨ ਨੇ ਵਿਆਹ ਦੇ ਕਰੀਬ ਇਕ ਮਹੀਨੇ ਬਾਅਦ ਖੁਦਕੁਸ਼ੀ ਕਰ ਲਈ। ਨੌਜਵਾਨ ਆਪਣੀ ਪਤਨੀ ਤੋਂ ਤੰਗ ਸੀ, ਜਿਸ ਕਾਰਨ ਉਸ ਨੇ ਇਹ ਖੌਫਨਾਕ ਕਦਮ ਚੁੱਕਿਆ। ਇਹ ਦੋਸ਼ ਪਰਿਵਾਰਕ ਮੈਂਬਰਾਂ ਨੇ ਲਾਏ ਹਨ। ਫਿਲਹਾਲ ਪੁਲਿਸ ਨੇ ਮਾਮਲਾ ਦਰਜ ਕਰ ਲਿਆ ਹੈ। ਦਰਅਸਲ, ਵਿਆਹ ਦੇ ਅਗਲੇ ਦਿਨ ਹੀ ਪਤੀ-ਪਤਨੀ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਝਗੜਾ ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਦੋਸ਼ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਪਤਨੀ ਨੇ ਨੌਜਵਾਨ ਨੂੰ ਨਪੁੰਸਕ ਕਿਹਾ ਸੀ। ਪੁਲਿਸ ਨੇ ਉਸ ਦੀ ਪਤਨੀ, ਸੱਸ ਅਤੇ ਸਹੁਰੇ ਖ਼ਿਲਾਫ਼ ਕੇਸ ਦਰਜ ਕਰ ਲਿਆ ਹੈ। ਗੋਹਾਨਾ ਦੇ ਸਮਤਾ ਚੌਕ ਵਾਲਮੀਕੀ ਕਲੋਨੀ ਦਾ ਰਹਿਣ ਵਾਲਾ ਨਵੀਨ ਲੇਡੀਜ਼ ਗਾਰਮੈਂਟਸ ਦੀ ਦੁਕਾਨ ‘ਤੇ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਦਾ ਸੀ।...

title: 四位汽车发烧友将经典香港出租车带到墨尔本
content: 红色出租车在香港司空见惯。但在墨尔本,一群怀旧的朋友让一辆香港出租车吸引了众人的目光。 几名汽车爱好者——维克多(Victor Man)、马尔科姆(Malcolm Lam)、杰基(Jacky Chu)和文森特(Vincent)借助标志性的香港出租车来纪念他们的文化传承。 遇到志趣相投的汽车的爱好者后,他们把一辆改装过的丰田皇冠(Crown)汽车从昆州带到维州。 “有一点红色、有一点招摇、还带有一点标志性” 新冠疫情期间他们去墨尔本一家香港茶餐厅时,脑海中突然蹦出了这个主意。 由于海外旅行限制,几个朋友决定给墨尔本带来些许香港的味道。 订阅中文简报 订阅ABC中文周报 网罗每周精选内容 “如果因为疫情不能回家,我们就会把家乡的一部分带过来,”文森特说。 他们考虑了各种各样的标志性象征,最后选择了红色出租车。在香港街头,这是常见的一种交通工具。 “每个香港人都有与出租车有关的故事,不管是好的故事还是不好的故事。” 在昆士兰发现心仪的出租车 经过一番搜寻,他们来到昆州。在一个车间的角落,他们发现了梦想中的汽车,一辆色彩艳丽的红色丰田皇冠(Toyota Crown)汽车。...

title: Elon Musk Cuts Ties With California and Announces Texas as New X, SpaceX Headquarters
content: Elon Musk , the entrepreneur and owner of companies X and SpaceX, said he will be moving the headquarters of said companies from California to Texas. The Tesla CEO is outraged due to California's new law, which is intended to protect transgender students at school. The bill, signed by Governor Gavin Newsom (D-CA), prevents policies which force educators to tell the student's parents if the child has asked to use a different name or different pronouns. title: Aptos’ 10s All-Stars see postseason run end with second, narrow loss to Willow Glen | Little League
content: SUNNYVALE — One run. One lousy run. That was the difference between a joyous victory and a bitter defeat. Hudson Gall drew a walk in the fourth inning and Bodie Cross doubled him home for the decisive run. title: 4トンを超えるコカイン押収 南米パラグアイ史上最大の量(AP通信)
content: 現在JavaScriptが無効になっています Yahoo!ニュースのすべての機能を利用するためには、JavaScriptの設定を有効にしてください。 JavaScriptの設定を変更する方法はこちら 7/17(水) 14:48 配信 アスンシオン、パラグアイ、7月17日 (AP) ― 南米パラグアイ当局は7月16日、ベルギー向けの砂糖コンテナに隠された4トンを超えるコカインを発見し、およそ約379億円相当の麻薬を押収した。4トンを超える押収量は同国史上最大の量だという。 同国麻薬対策機関の捜査官らは15日、首都アスンシオンの河川港プエルト・カアクペミで、40キロの砂糖袋が詰った輸送コンテナの開梱を開始。16日になっても、貨物の中に隠されていたコカインの選別と計量は続いたという。 パラグアイは戦略的立地にあることから、近年この地域の麻薬密売の重要な拠点となっていた。 麻薬の出所は明らかになっていない。近隣のボリビア、コロンビア、ペルーとは異なり、パラグアイはコカインを生産していない。...

title: Governor Bii seeks to reduce Uasin Gishu wage bill by 10%
content: The Uasin Gishu government's wage bill of 45 per cent is a major hindrance to development, Governor Jonathan Bii has said. He said his administration is looking for ways to reduce the wage bill to 35 per cent as required by the law. “One way to bring down the wage bill is by gradually increasing our own source revenue," Bii said. The county has centralised revenue collection and licensing at its newly established service centre . Bii said the centralisation of the collection has helped the...

title: UN Declares 2025-2034 as Decade to Combat Sand and Dust Storms
content: Sand and dust storms (SDS) have been more frequent and intense in recent years, especially in some areas. This has led to severe agricultural damage, accelerated desertification, and increased health hazards. It is estimated that approximately 2 billion tonnes of sand and dust are released into the atmosphere annually. Recognizing the urgent need to address this issue, the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) has proclaimed as the United Nations Decade on Combating Sand and Dust Storms. This...

title: Lulu唱《蘑菇濃湯》被青峰切割 親吐心聲:尊重每個人的選擇
content: Lulu。(台視提供) 〔記者侯家瑜/台北報導〕LuLu上月底在金曲獎頒獎典禮上,改編兒歌《蘑菇濃湯》揭開序幕,不過該曲其實具爭議性,當事人青峰曾公開其黑幕。今爆出青峰已經默默將Lulu,從IG追蹤名單中移除,對此,Lulu也透過經紀人給出回應。 《蘑菇濃湯》是青峰前經紀人林暐哲公司的作品,而青峰曾公開歌曲黑幕,並以「毒菇」一詞加以諷刺,部分觀眾認為主辦單位思慮不周,不該讓重要典禮上出現具爭議性的歌曲。事後青峰未給出任何回應,但近期卻有眼尖網友發現,他已經將Lulu從IG追蹤名單中移除,似乎想默默切割2人的關係,而Lulu稍早則透過經紀人表態:「身分不同,角度跟立場不同,我們尊重每個人的選擇,也希望可以多一點包容與理解。」 請繼續往下閱讀... 事實上,LuLu上月也曾被問到選《蘑菇濃湯》重新翻唱的原因,她表示除了自己喜歡童趣風的東西外,整體的曲風也很適合自己的演出風格,再加上與團隊討論後,覺得選擇兒歌的概念與這次金曲典禮的開場白概念不謀而合,「因為每一個音樂作品都像音樂人孕育出的小孩,用兒歌切入,可以說是再適合不過。」 不用抽 不用搶 現在用APP看新聞 保證天天中獎...

title: Why 133,000 men die early every year in UK - including suicide
creator: newsdesk@walesonline.co.uk (Neil Shaw)
content: More than 133,000 men die early every year in the UK, often from preventable illnesses, according to a new report. Two in five of all men die too young, while those living in the most deprived regions are 81% more likely to die prematurely than those in the wealthiest, according to the charity Movember. Its new report found the health of men in the UK is worse than in many other wealthy countries. A boy born in the UK in 2021 can expect to live to 78.7 – four years less than a girl, more than...

title: US police shoot knife-wielding man near Republican convention
content: OHIO POLICE OFFICERS in Wisconsin for the Republican National Convention shot and killed a man who was wielding two knives near the event, police said. Milwaukee Police chief Jeffrey Norman said at a news conference that five police officers from Columbus, Ohio opened fire on the man after he ignored commands to drop the knives and then charged at an unarmed person. Two knives were recovered from the scene, he added. Police body camera footage from the incident depicted two officers on bikes...

title: The simple fix that could slash bird deaths from wind farms

content: The number of birds striking wind turbines could be dramatically reduced by simple fixes such as painting one blade black, while technology to detect eagles and stop turbines spinning is paying dividends in Tasmania. title: British men missing in Sweden with 2 bodies found shot in burnt-out car
creator: mylondonnewsdesk@reachplc.com (Rachel Vickers-Price, PA, Alya Zayed)
content: Police in Sweden have launched a double murder investigation after two bodies were found shot in a burnt-out car that had been rented by a British citizen, local media has reported. According to Swedish national newspaper Aftonbladet, the car had been rented from Copenhagen airport before the driver and the passenger drove across the Denmark-Sweden border and into the city of Malmo. Swedish Police said the victims were shot on Sunday, with the Toyota RAV4 then set on fire in an industrial area...

content: BERLINO (dpa-AFX) - Il fornitore di servizi finanziari Hypoport ha continuato a crescere grazie alla ripresa dei finanziamenti immobiliari e all'aumento della quota di mercato. A six-month delay in military assistance from the US, the biggest single contributor to Ukraine, opened the door for the Kremlin's forces to push on the front line. content: Three huge storms led to record rainfall in parts of Toronto, Canada, on Tuesday, causing widespread flooding. title: Asking Eric: Father hid son’s affair from Mom
creator: BY R. ERIC THOMAS Tribune Content Agency
content: Dear Eric: My son recently announced that he and his wife are divorcing. Shortly after that, I found out my son had an affair with the daughter of my ex-husband’s wife. Technically, the other woman is his step-sister but they only all met as adults, so it’s not cringe-inducing incestuous. content: What do whole anchovies, sardines, smelt and herring offer you that you can’t get from a filet of sole? Bones, head, organs and other inside treasures that contain micronutrients like zinc, selenium, and magnesium and a good dose of calcium, and vitamins B12, D and niacin. Sardines, for example, also deliver almost 25 grams of protein in every 3 ounces. And then there’s the omega-3s that they contain that help protect your heart health and tamp down body-wide inflammation that’s the culprit in...

creator: The Associated Press

creator: BY COLLEEN LONG and ZEKE MILLER The Associated Press
content: WASHINGTON — President Joe Biden is seriously considering proposals to establish term limits for U.S. Supreme Court justices, and an ethics code that would be enforceable under law amid growing concerns that the justices are not held accountable, according to three people briefed on the plans. title: IMF's economic view: Brighter outlook for China, India but tepid global growth
creator: BY PAUL WISEMAN The Associated Press
content: WASHINGTON — The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday upgraded its economic outlook this year for China, India and Europe while modestly lowering expectations for the United States and Japan. But it says worldwide progress against accelerating prices has been slowed by stickier-than-expected inflation for services, from airline travel to restaurant meals. Overall, the IMF said it still expects the world economy to grow a lackluster 3.2% this year, unchanged from its previous forecast in April...

title: Retail sales unchanged in June from May, underscoring shoppers' resilience
creator: The Associated Press
content: NEW YORK — Shoppers paused their spending in June from May, defying economic forecasts for a pullback and proving their resilience in the face of an uncertain economy Retail sales were unchanged in June from May, after being revised upward to a 0.3% increase in May, according to the Commerce Department. Last month, April sales were revised downward — a 0.2% decline, from unchanged. Sales rose 0.6% in March and 0.9% in February. That comes after sales fell 1.1% in January, dragged down in part...

creator: The Associated Press
content: Small business sales growth slowed in June as consumers took a pause on spending. That’s according to new data from financial services and payments provider Fiserv. Consumers have been reining in spending as high prices on groceries and other necessities and high interest rates weigh on their pocketbooks. title: WhatsApp now lets users set contacts and groups as ‘favourites’ for easier access
content: WhatsApp has introduced the ability to add contacts and groups as favourites, allowing users to filter through chats more quickly. The feature functions as an additional Chat Filter, which hides all conversations except those added as a favourite. Chat Filters were introduced in April this year, allowing users to display all messages, filter by unread messages, or only show group chats. title: Israeli strikes in southern, central Gaza kill more than 60 Palestinians
creator: The Associated Press
content: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — Israeli airstrikes killed more than 60 Palestinians in southern and central Gaza overnight and into Tuesday, including one that struck an Israeli-declared “safe zone” crowded with thousands of displaced people. Airstrikes in recent days have brought a constant drumbeat of deaths of Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, even as Israel has pulled back or scaled down major ground offensives in the north and south. title: When extreme weather hits, how do we know if climate change or bad luck is to blame?
creator: The Straits Times
content: Heat waves are most directly linked to carbon pollution. NEW YORK – For several decades, scientists have gathered evidence that the global warming caused by greenhouse gas emissions is making some types of extreme weather more likely or more intense. It’s a bigger challenge to connect climate change to a particular weather event at a specific time and place. But the science that enables researchers to do just that has advanced over the past 20 years to the point where individual heat spells,...

title: Commentary: The American tragedy of the Trump assassination attempt
creator: BY DENNIS AFTERGUT and AUSTIN SARAT The Fulcrum
content: Saturday’s assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump was a crime against the entire country and against democracy itself. Every American should be grateful that it failed, and that Trump has survived it. Let’s say it plainly. It is an abomination that he was wounded as he campaigned for a return to the White House. title: Caesar salad, invented in Mexico by Italian immigrants, is still pleasing palates after 100 years
creator: BY DEE-ANN DURBIN The Associated Press
content: Caesar salad has something to celebrate: It’s turning 100. Italian immigrant Caesar Cardini is said to have invented the dish on July 4, 1924, at his restaurant, Caesar’s Place, in Tijuana, Mexico . It was a steamy night, and Cardini was struggling to feed an influx of Californians who had crossed the border to escape Prohibition . title: Feds disrupted Christmastime plot to have Santa Claus give out poison candy
content: Federal authorities said Tuesday that they disrupted a neo-Nazi plot last year to have a person dressed as Santa Claus give out poisoned candy to racial minorities in New York City. Authorities said the plot also envisioned sending ricin-laced candy to Jewish schools in Brooklyn. title: Active commuters may have lower risks of mental and physical ill health
content: Commuters who cycle or walk to and from work or study may have lower risks of mental and physical ill health than those who don't rely on these options, finds a large long term study published in the open access journal BMJ Public Health. While health benefits were observed for both types of active commuting, the strongest health benefits were seen for cyclists among whom the risk of death from any cause was 47% lower, the findings show. title: Sports News | Bawa Signs off with Bronze at World Junior Squash
content: New Delhi, Jul 17 (PTI) India's Shaurya Bawa signed off with a bronze medal after going down 0-3 to Egyptian top seed Mohamed Zakaria in the boys' singles semifinal of the World Junior Squash Championships in Houston. Bawa lost 5-11 5-11 9-11 to last year's runner-up Zakaria in a thrilling 41-minute semifinal contest. Bawa is only the second Indian male after Kush Kumar (in 2014) to reach the World Junior semifinals.

title: Why Do We Really Blush? Brain Scans Reveal It's Not What You Think.
creator: Clare Watson
content: Uncontrollable yet predictable, obvious yet inexplicable, blushing can be agony when we're made to feel mortified, ashamed, or simply self-conscious. title: Three days on, Trump shooter's motive still shrouded in mystery

title: Cane toad-break zone to stop notorious pest march in WA
creator: Abe Maddison
content: The dry expanse of Western Australia’s north has created a unique opportunity to stop the relentless march of invasive cane toads across the nation. A “toad-break” zone devoid of the water they need to survive will stop them from infiltrating WA’s Pilbara region and protect its 27 million hectares of sensitive habitat, Indigenous cultural heritage and native wildlife. The WA government has announced funding for the first phase of the Toad Containment Zone, a collaborative project involving...

title: Mario Balotelli in talks over transfer eight years on from Liverpool nightmare
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Ben Crawford)
content: Ex- Liverpool and Manchester City striker Mario Balotelli is in talks with Brazilian club Corinthians after becoming a free agent last month. title: Adolescents 'get most calories from processed food'
content: Adolescents get about two-thirds of their calorie intake from highly processed foods, a new study has concluded. title: Delhi Doctors Report Rise In Hand, Foot, Mouth Disease In Children
content: Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease (HFMD) predominantly affects infants and young children. Monsoon is driving cases of a highly contagious hand, foot, and mouth disease (HFMD) -- a common viral illness -- in young children in the national capital, said doctors here on Wednesday. Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease (HFMD) predominantly affects infants and young children, and is characterised by a combination of symptoms including fever, sore throat, mouth sores, and a rash on the hands and feet. The disease...

title: Permanent Sunday market to open by the river in Morningside
creator: Nick Dent
content: Erected in 1917, the sprawling brick buildings in what is now known as the Rivermakers precinct in Morningside were originally a factory that made acetate of lime for World War I armaments. During the Second World War the site became a naval barracks and later, a migrant hostel and home of the Queensland Fish Board. In the 1970s it was taken over by the Hans Smallgoods factory. Rivermakers in Morningside is a historical site now given over to hospitality, events and markets. Credit: BMI Now...

content: FIRST-year St Kilda forward Lance Collard has received a six-game ban for using homophobic slurs against his opponents during a VFL game last weekend. title: ASML posts second-quarter earnings of $1.7 billion, bookings rise
content: AMSTERDAM : ASML, the largest equipment supplier to chipmakers, on Wednesday reported better-than-expected second-quarter net income of 1.6 billion euros ($1.7 billion) on revenues of 6.2 billion euros, while new bookings rose. Analysts had seen net income at 1.41 billion euros on revenue of 6.04 billion euros, according to LSEG data. The second-quarter numbers compare with net income of 1.94 billion euros and sales of 6.90 billion euros a year earlier. ($1 = 0.9173 euros)

title: Former ABC broadcaster and NRL Hall of Fame inductee David Morrow dies
content: In short: Former ABC sports broadcaster David Morrow, who was announced as an inductee into the NRL Hall of Fame last week, has died at the age of 71. Morrow died after being diagnosed with brain cancer earlier this year. Born in Sydney, Morrow began his career in country New South Wales as a general announcer with radio 2KM (now 2MC) in Kempsey in 1971. title: World Junior Squash Championship: Bawa loses to top seed Zakaria in semifinal, collects bronze medal
content: India’s Shaurya Bawa went down to Egyptian top seed Mohamed Zakaria in the boys’ singles semifinal of the World Junior Squash Championships in Houston on Tuesday. Bawa, seeded 17/32, lost 5-11, 5-11, 9-11 to last year’s runner-up Zakaria, with the 41-minute long contest closer than what the scoreline suggests. Bawa is only the second Indian male after Kush Kumar (in 2014) to reach the World Junior semifinal and will collect a bronze medal. Comments Related stories Related Topics

title: Photos: First day of the Republican National Convention
content: The Republican National Convention is underway in Milwaukee. The city of beers and brats was supposed to host the Democratic convention four years ago, but the in-person gathering was canceled due to the COVID-19 pandemic. title: Trump shooting lowers pressure on Biden to drop out
content: Republicans have been featuring Vice President Kamala Harris prominently in their attacks on the Biden administration at this week's convention in Milwaukee — a sign that they believe President Biden could still step aside and elevate her to the top of the ticket. title: Heat wave may have increased spread of H5N1 at poultry farm
content: An H5N1 outbreak that recently infected five poultry workers and 1.8 million chickens in northeast Colorado may have been fueled in part by heat wave conditions and slaughtering methods, according to federal health authorities. content: Thousands of poverty-stricken children in El Salvador have suffered arbitrary detention, torture and other abuse as part of President Nayib Bukele's "war on gangs," Human Rights Watch said in a report released Tuesday. content: Online fraudsters who defrauded a Kasaragod merchant navy sailor of nearly Rs 2 crore duped the spouse of a senior Army officer posted in the Defence Ministry in New Delhi. title: After reshaping Las Vegas, The Mirage to be reinvented as part of a massive Hard Rock makeover
creator: Ken Ritter, The Associated Press
content: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The Mirage is about to vanish from the Las Vegas Strip. Gambling ends and the doors close Wednesday at the iconic tropical island-themed hotel-casino that opened in 1989 with a fire-spewing volcano outside, and Siegfried & Roy's lions and dolphins inside. Frenzied final days have seen standing-room crowds wagering to win $1.6 million in slot machine progressive jackpot winnings that state regulations say have to be disbursed before the lights go out and a massive transformation...

Deputy Auditor General Marlon McAdam told members of the PAC that of the 44 opinions issued by the auditor general in relation to financial statements submitted by municipal corporations, 38 – or 86 per cent – of them are disclaimers. title: Rotorua neighbours of former reserve reflect on its sale, councillor questions price
creator: Laura Smith
content: The neighbour who mowed a former Rotorua reserve set to be used for housing says it is a shame to see the “godsend” go – but “progress is progress”. Geoff Bracken has fond memories of taking care of the Clayton Rd land over the 12 years he has lived next door. Rotorua Lakes Council declared it surplus land in 1982, and two years later revoked its status as a reserve. It sat vacant for decades, occasionally used for grazing, and in 2022 the council decided to seek a partner to develop it.

content: SYDNEY, July 17 — Australia vowed Wednesday to hold Russia to account for the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 ten years ago that killed nearly 300 people. On July 17, 2014 the Boeing 777 — en route from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur — was shot down by a Russian-made BUK surface-to-air missile over eastern Ukraine. title: CTO charm wears thin within Indian startups as they conserve cash and hire internally
content: New-age companies that have relied on tech to drive disruption are now opting out of hiring replacements for the once-prized chief technology officer (CTO) role after the position becomes vacant, in a bid to cut costs during the ongoing funding downturn. content: LONDON (Reuters) -Pernod Ricard said on Wednesday it agreed to sell the majority of its wine portfolio to the owners of Australia's Accolade Wines, disposing of a dragging division to focus on its core business of spirits. The world's No.2 Western spirits maker plans to sell its wine brands from Australia, New Zealand and Spain, including well-known labels like Jacobs Creek, Stoneleigh and Campo Viejo, subject to regulatory approvals. It did not disclose a price. The move will see Pernod hone...

title: Nottingham pub Mist Rolling Inn losing 75% trade as view obscured by scaffolding
creator: newsdesk@nottinghampost.com (Lynette Pinchess)
content: A Nottingham pub owner claims his takings have nosedived by 75 percent after scaffolding was erected for work on flats above. Dave Hawyes said he relies heavily on passing trade but the view of the micro pub, Mist Rolling Inn , has been obscured since February when renovations began. As well as scaffolding there's a skip and a partitioned off portable toilet for workmen. Mr Hawyes has laid off three staff and said he fears for the future of the business in Derby Road, near Canning Circus. He...

title: Chennedy Carter scores 34 and Angel Reese records another double-double as the Chicago Sky beat the Las Vegas Aces
creator: Associated Press
content: LAS VEGAS — Chennedy Carter scored 34 points, Angel Reese had 13 points and 10 rebounds for her 16th double-double in the last 17 games, and the Chicago Sky beat the Las Vegas Aces 93-85 on Tuesday night. Chicago led 42-21 at the midway point of the second quarter and held the advantage until Megan Gustafson made a 3-pointer from the corner with 8:16 remaining in the fourth to give the Aces their first lead of the game at 72-71. title: Maybank to impose cooling-off period for transfer limit increases starting July 31
content: PETALING JAYA: Maybank will introduce a 12-hour cooling-off period for transfer limit increase requests on its Maybank2U website, effective July 31. Flood Alert in Eastern Uttar Pradesh as Rivers Approach Danger Levels | ABP News
creator: ABP News Bureau
content: The rivers in eastern Uttar Pradesh are already in spate, and the additional water flowing in from Nepal has exacerbated the situation, causing significant concern. title: Roman Baths lose £90,000 after switching to contactless wishing well
creator: newsdesk@westgaz.co.uk (Phoebe Hobbs)
content: A popular Bath tourist site has spoken out after it was revealed that they lost £90,000 after switching to contactless wishing wells. content: The lawyer leading a $65 billion class action lawsuit against BHP over the Fundao dam collapse in Brazil says the “blockbuster” trial, due to start in October, will expose a number of decisions taken by the miner to prioritise profit over safety. BHP is embroiled in the legal stoush after more than 600,000 claimants went to the English High Court seeking to hold the mining giant financially liable for the disaster. The Fundao tailings dam burst in 2015 at Samarco’s Mariana mine complex in...

title: Safety concerns for youths climbing Wallingford Castle
content: Wallingford Castle was saved from ruin in 2023 following a grant of almost £300,000 from Historic England. Youths have been spotted climbing the castle by a system installed recently which captures live images of trespassers. The system consists of a camera linked to pressure and motion sensors which captures a live image if someone is in an area they aren't supposed to be. These incidents have led to damage of the castle which the Mayor of Wallingford Daniel Beauchamp said is "frustrating"....
